column1: Cafe Ba-Ba-Reeba!////Who doesn't love tapas. Amendment: who doesn't love tapas at a place that has 5 varieties of sangria. My sister and I were in the area
column2: and it's her favorite restaurant. We didn't have a reservation
column3: but we thought we'd try out luck. At 5:15 on a Saturday
column4: we were seated no problem. We found our table and immediately were presented with a basket of rustic bread- crusty outside
column5: soft inside. And that was just the bread
column6: friends. First order of real business was ordering sangria. I'm not one for sweet drinks
column7: so we went with the Cava variety. It was pretty good. Still a little sweet
column8: but not bad. We ordered a whole pitcher for 2 people (ambitious
column9: I know). It was a lot of carbonation considering how many glasses we ended up having
